transcript.text: Welcome to our video on Modern Language Models and Their Impact on Linguistic Theories.
In this video, we'll explore how these models have challenged and disproved Chomsky's approach
to language. For years, Chomsky claimed that language is innate, something we're born with.
But recent studies have shown that this may not be the case.
Modern language models have implemented genuine theories of language,
including representations of syntactic and semantic structure,
without using traditional linguistic methods. However, some critics argue that these large
language models still fall short in answering why questions, and their relevance, to real-life
language acquisition. They also point out that humans learn from the structure of the world
around them, not just the structure of language itself. But there are examples of children raised
in isolation who spontaneously develop a form of communication indicating an innate capability
for acquiring languages among humans. So while modern language models may challenge traditional
approaches to linguistics, they still have limitations when it comes to understanding
human communication fully. What do you think about modern language models?
Let us know your thoughts in the comments below.
